stem: A 19-year-old client with a tibial fracture and a full leg cast reports 'unbearable' pain. Based on the documentation in the Neurovascular & Pressure Surveillance Log, what is the most appropriate nursing intervention?

options.text: Notify the surgeon immediately and prepare for cast removal/bivalving
Elevate the limb above the level of the heart
Apply ice packs over the cast to reduce swelling
Administer an additional dose of IV Morphine

rationale.correct: This is **Compartment Syndrome (a1)**, a surgical emergency where pressure within the muscle fascia exceeds capillary perfusion pressure. The 'Pain out of proportion' to the injury and **pain with passive stretch** are the most sensitive early indicators. The nurse must **notify the surgeon immediately (a1)** and prepare to remove the external pressure (cast). **Never elevate (a2)** a limb with suspected compartment syndrome, as this further decreases the already compromised arterial perfusion pressure.
clinicalPearls: The 6 Ps: Pain (Earliest), Pressure, Paresthesia, Pallor, Paralysis, Pulselessness (Latest).
Treat like a heart attack of the muscle: Time is tissue.
Priority: 1. Neutral position (NOT elevation). 2. Remove cast. 3. Emergency Fasciotomy.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Elevation and Ice are standard for *simple* sprains, but in **Compartment Syndrome**, they worsen the ischemia. If you see 'Pain with passive stretch,' it is a compartment emergencyâ€”not a simple bruise.

mnemonic.title: Passive-Pain
mnemonic.expansion: Passive stretch = Massive pain. Call the doc, or they'll lose the vein (and muscle).

exhibits.title: Neurovascular Exam
exhibits.content: Current: Pain 10/10, not relieved by 4mg IV Morphine. Pain increases significantly with passive stretch of the toes. Skin of the foot is pale and tense. Capillary refill > 5 seconds. Dorsalis pedis pulse is +1 (Weak).

exhibits.title: Vital Signs
exhibits.content:
BP 152/88 (Pain-related). HR 112. RR 22.
Condition: Client is thrashing in bed and guarding the limb.

exhibits.title: Surgical Context
exhibits.content:
Note: Tibial fracture occurred 12 hours ago. Cast applied 4 hours ago.
Sensory: Client reports 'tingling' (paresthesia) in the web-space between the first and second toes.
